definition: to hasten/to hurry/to walk fast/to approach/to tend towards/to converge

sentences.english: Considerable cross-national convergence in life expectancy will occur.
sentences.chinese: 預期壽命將會出現可觀的跨國趨同。

sentences.english: Economic globalization has also led to cultural homogenization.
sentences.chinese: 經濟全球化也導致了文化的趨同性。

sentences.english: The “great convergence” is an epoch-making transformation.
sentences.chinese: “大趨同”是一個劃時代的轉變。

sentences.english: Plants had gradually evolved along diverging and converging pathways.
sentences.chinese: 植物是沿着趨異和趨同兩種途徑逐漸演化的。

sentences.english: In the later stage of Shang dynasty and later, the structure was convergent.
sentences.chinese: 商晚期後，形制趨同，體現了禮制的規範與完善。
心理學家稱此爲“趨同思維”。

sentences.english: The convergent inclination in universities is the result of legality mechanism.
sentences.chinese: 高校的趨同性正是合法性機制作用的結果。

sentences.english: Promote convergence of standards for harvesting metadata.
sentences.chinese: 推進獲取元數據的標準趨同化。

sentences.english: And that makes all the difference in the world.
sentences.chinese: 那樣就使這個世界裏的一切不同而趨同。

sentences.english: Recent indicators point to greater convergence.
sentences.chinese: 近期指標顯示更加趨同。

definition: to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
twisted roots and intertwined joints (idiom); complicated and very tricky/knotty and deeply-rooted difficulties
